name: MachineIdentityExtension
description: Generate keys and simplify certificate acquisition by eliminating the need to write code to interact with the Venafi REST API.  Azure DevOps extension for Venafi VCert, https://github.com/Venafi/vcert.
author: Greg Brownstein

inputs.name: action
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the action to perform

inputs.name: serverType
inputs.label: Server Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Server type to connect to

inputs.name: serverUrlTpp
inputs.label: Server URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: TPP server URL, eg. tpp.venafi.example. 'https://' will be appended automatically.

inputs.name: authTokenTpp
inputs.label: Auth Token
inputs.helpMarkDown: Authentication token, requires TPP v20.1 or greater

inputs.name: apiKeyCloud
inputs.label: API Key
inputs.helpMarkDown:
API key for Venafi Cloud.

Example: vvvvvvvv-wwww-xxxx-yyyy-zzzzzzzzzzzz

inputs.name: enrollZoneCloud
inputs.label: Project Zone
inputs.helpMarkDown: Application and associated issuing template in the form application\template

inputs.name: enrollZoneTpp
inputs.label: Target Folder Path
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Folder path where the certificate object will be placed. \VED\Policy will be prepended, you only need to specify child folders under the root Policy folder.

Example: DevOps\CorpApp

inputs.name: enrollKeyPassword
inputs.label: Private Key Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password for encrypting the private key.  Specifying a value here will override the default non-encrypted private key.  It is recommended to use a secret variable, <https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/process/variables?view=azure-devops&tabs=yaml%2Cbatch#secret-variables>.

inputs.name: enrollChain
inputs.label: Chain
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use to include the certificate chain in the output, and to specify where to place it in the file.

inputs.name: enrollCsrTpp
inputs.label: Certificate Signing Request (CSR)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify the CSR and private key location.

Local: private key and CSR will be generated locally
Service: private key and CSR will be generated within Venafi Platform
File: CSR will be read from a file by name

inputs.name: enrollCsrCloud
inputs.label: Certificate Signing Request (CSR)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify the CSR and private key location.

Local: private key and CSR will be generated locally
File: CSR will be read from a file by name

inputs.name: enrollCsrFile
inputs.label: CSR File
inputs.helpMarkDown: File to read the CSR from

inputs.name: enrollSanDns
inputs.label: DNS SAN
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use to specify a DNS Subject Alternative Name. To specify more than one, separate with a comma.

inputs.name: enrollSanEmailTpp
inputs.label: Email SAN
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use to specify a Email Subject Alternative Name. To specify more than one, separate with a comma.

inputs.name: enrollSanIpTpp
inputs.label: IP SAN
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use to specify a IP Subject Alternative Name. To specify more than one, separate with a comma.

inputs.name: enrollNicknameTpp
inputs.label: New Certificate Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Create a new certificate with the same CN, but a distinct object in TPP.

inputs.name: enrollCustomFieldsTpp
inputs.label: Custom Fields
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter custom fields in json format.  To provide more than 1 value per name, separate the values with a comma.  Click on the elipsis to edit easily.

inputs.name: enrollNoPickup
inputs.label: Retrieve Certificate Later
inputs.helpMarkDown: By default, VCert will try to retrieve the certificate for 60 seconds.  If your CA might not respond in time or your workflow requires it, you can choose to not retrieve the certificate now and do so later with the pickup id which is automatically saved as environment variable VCERT_ID.

inputs.name: enrollOutputType
inputs.label: Certificate Output
inputs.helpMarkDown: Output to either a file or an environment variable to be used in a subsequent task.  The option for an environment variable is only available for pem and json formats.

inputs.name: enrollOutputFile
inputs.label: Certificate Output File Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to output file.  Required if output type 'file' was selected or format is either PKCS#12 or JKS.

inputs.name: pickupIdFrom
inputs.label: Pickup ID From
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Where to get the pickup ID from.

Environment variable: From VCERT_ID from a prior VCert Request operation.
ID: provide the pickup ID
File path: provide the path to a file which contains the pickup ID

inputs.name: pickupId
inputs.label: ID / Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Reference ID for certificate to pickup.  For Venafi Cloud this will be a GUID and for TPP this will be the path to the certificate, eg. \ved\policy\mycert.com

inputs.name: pickupOutputType
inputs.label: Certificate Output
inputs.helpMarkDown: Output to either a file or an environment variable to be used in a subsequent task.  The option for an environment variable is only available for pem and json formats.

inputs.name: pickupOutputFile
inputs.label: Certificate Output File Path
inputs.visibleRule: pickupOutputType = outputFile || pickupFormat = pkcs12 || pickupFormat = jks
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to output file.  Required if output type 'file' was selected or format is either PKCS#12 or JKS.

inputs.name: renewIdFrom
inputs.label: Certificate ID From
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Where to get the certificate ID from.

Environment variable: From VCERT_ID from a prior VCert Request operation.
ID: provide the renew ID
File path: provide the path to a file which contains the renew ID

inputs.name: renewId
inputs.label: ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Reference ID for certificate to renew.  For Venafi Cloud this will be a GUID and for TPP this will be the path to the certificate, eg. \ved\policy\mycert.com

inputs.name: verbose
inputs.label: Verbose
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use to increase the level of logging detail, which is helpful when troubleshooting issues.

inputs.name: testMode
inputs.label: Test Mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use to test operations without connecting to Venafi Platform. This option is useful for integration tests where the test environment does not have access to Venafi Platform
